paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the BRCA2 variant c.517-2A>G, including clinical significance, penetrance data, and individual records.

patients.demographics: 60% female, mean age at recruitment 49.8 years (range 18–93)

individual_records.evidence_sentence: One of the female c.517-2A>G carrier participants has a diagnosis of breast cancer.
None of the other seven carriers (four females and three males) had any cancer code recorded.

functional_data.summary: The c.517-2A>G variant is predicted to affect mRNA splicing, resulting in a significantly altered protein due to exon skipping.

variants.segregation_data: The variant segregates with female breast and ovarian cancer in diagnosed cases.
variants.population_frequency: Carrier frequency 0.4% in VIKING I; ~130-fold higher than in UK Biobank.
variants.evidence_level: Strong evidence based on multifactorial likelihood analysis (posterior probability 0.9994).
variants.additional_notes: The variant is part of a founder effect in the Shetland population.
key_quotes: The c.517-2A>G variant (also known as IVS6-2A>G) has been reported in multiple individuals affected with Hereditary Breast and Ovarian Cancer worldwide, and is classed as pathogenic.

The interpretation that this base substitution is a pathogenic variant was demonstrated independently by multifactorial likelihood quantitative analysis (definitely pathogenic, posterior probability 0.9994).

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data was extracted from the main text.
